article_text:
Stocks bounced back, but traders remained glum as the concerns about global growth that have fueled recent declines persisted, warning of the potential for more volatility.

The Dow Jones Industrial Average snapped a three-day losing streak, gaining 293.03 points, or 1.8%, to 16351.38. Some of the sectors that have been hit hardest in the recent pullback regained some ground, with technology stocks and biotechnology shares leading the...

twitter.description: U.S. stocks rebounded Wednesday after falling sharply in the previous session on deepening worries about China.
twitter.creator: @DanStrumpf
twitter.title: U.S. Stocks Regain Footing

article_summary:
Some of the sectors that have been hit hardest in the recent pullback regained some ground, with technology stocks and biotechnology shares leading the...
Stocks bounced back, but traders remained glum as the concerns about global growth that have fueled recent declines persisted, warning of the potential for more volatility.
The Dow Jones Industrial Average snapped a three-day losing streak, gaining 293.03 points, or 1.8%, to 16351.38.
